alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sullivan County through 230 PM EDT... At 155 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Phillipsport, or 8 miles southwest of Ellenville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wurtsboro, Woodridge, Bloomingburg, Highview, Haven, Phillipsport, Rock Hill, Spring Glen, Mt Prosper and Mountain Dale. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 107 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
